intro: Nephrodium connexum, commonly known as the New Zealand tree fern, is a tropical plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, unbranched trunk and large, feather-like fronds. The plant has a unique reproductive system, with sporangia developing on the underside of its fronds. Its rhizome is thick and woody, allowing it to thrive in moist, shaded environments. Nephrodium connexum plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing habitat and food for various species.
